result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Moon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from deft requesting decision on motion for sentence credit without a hearing
Motion hearing on January 9, 2023 at 09:40 am.
Calendar call on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Sentence Credit- sent to JA
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:56 am 
INCLUDES 22CF6, 22TR1, & 22TR2. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty David Christian. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 22CF6: Cts. 3 & 4>>D&RI. 
In 22TR2>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 22CF6: Ct. 1 (Vehicle Operator Flee Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
               : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 22TR1: Ct. 1 (Speeding in 55MPH Zone (25-29 MPH))>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 22CF6: On Cts. 1 & 2>>3 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC & 2 yrs ES - CONDITIONS of ES>>AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions as prescribed; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). Def is entitled to 112 days credit. Def is eligible for SAP. Sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other and any other current sentence. 

In 21TR1>>$250.90 forfeiture, 6 months dl suspension, & 6 pts against dl.
